lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. The original template, Duke, is named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/astraea.Astraea.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run astraea.Astraea.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Astraea here. What do you want?
Hm. Be on your way, then.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

A bored deity offers to track your tasks for you. Don't question it.
Astraea is a task tracking program with command-line interface.
Add, list or remove tasks, mark or unmark tasks as
completed, search through tasks based on name, and set your own aliases for all built-in commands.
>Command format below places user-specified input in [square brackets]. All other text should exactly match.
>**User input is not allowed to contain the pipe character "|"**.
Creates a new task with custom task names and date parameters.
- **Deadline** tasks with name and deadline time
- `[time]` can be tracked as date/datetime if in format `YYYY-MM-DD`/`YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM`
- **Event** tasks with name, start time and end time
- `[time]` can be tracked as date/datetime if **_both arguments_** are in format`YYYY-MM-DD`/`YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM`
Shows all the tasks currently tracked, their index and their completion state.
Sets a task as done or not done. Warns user when index is out of bounds.
Format `mark [index]` or `unmark [index]`, with `[index]` as a single numeric integer
Deletes a task. Warns user when index is out of bounds.
Format: `delete [index]`, with `[index]` as a single numeric integer
Searches through all currently tracked tasks and lists any that contains the search term in its name.
Adds a new alias for a built-in command, allowing you to use that alias instead of the full command name.
Warns the user if the command name is invalid, or if the alias name is already in use.
`[command name]` must always be the full command name, regardless of whether you have previously set an alias.
Removes an existing alias for a built-in command. Warns the user if the alias name cannot be found.
Shows an exit message, greys out and prevents the input field and button from being used, then closes the application
Astraea automatically saves the tasks and aliases you create whenever their state is updated.
There is no need to save manually.

return new String[] {"Astraea here. What do you want?"};
// stop user inputs in the text box and button
stop(); // Ensure stop() is called only after the delay

// valid mark command returns ToggleCommand with argument index separated
// valid unmark command returns ToggleCommand with index separated
// valid todotask command returns TodoCommand with name separated
cmd = Parser.parseInput("todo test phrase to copy");
assertEquals(new TodoCommand(CommandType.TODO, new String[]{"test phrase to copy"}), cmd);
// valid deadline command returns DeadlineCommand with name and deadline separated
cmd = Parser.parseInput("deadline test phrase to copy /by test time to copy");
new String[]{"test phrase to copy", "test time to copy"}), cmd);
// valid event command returns EventCommand with name, start and end separated
cmd = Parser.parseInput("event test phrase to copy /from start time to copy /to end time to copy");
new String[]{"test phrase to copy", "start time to copy", "end time to copy"}), cmd);
// valid delete command returns DeleteCommand with index separated
// valid find command returns FindCommand with name separated
cmd = Parser.parseInput("find test phrase to copy");
assertEquals(new FindCommand(CommandType.FIND, new String[]{"test phrase to copy"}), cmd);

new TestCase("event test name /from start time without end", "event_noEnd"),
